alert.note: Alert for Iberia; Lafayette; St. Landry; St. Martin; St. Mary; Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 24 at 7:19PM CST until January 24 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CST FOR IBERIA...EASTERN LAFAYETTE...ST. MARY...EASTERN VERMILION...ST. MARTIN AND SOUTHEASTERN ST. LANDRY PARISHES... At 719 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Fort Adams to near St. Martinville to 8 miles south of Intracoastal City, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, New Iberia, Morgan City, Abbeville, Catahoula, Breaux Bridge, Franklin, Carencro, St. Martinville, Patterson, Jeanerette, Berwick, Arnaudville, Freshwater City, Belle River, Intracoastal City, Bayou Vista, Avery Island, Burns Point and Cypremort Point. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for south central, central and southwestern Louisiana. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into a small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Iberia; Lafayette; St. Landry; St. Martin; St. Mary; Vermilion
